subsection_content:
When people with diabetes are suspected of having problems related to diabetic retinopathy, their doctor will prescribe an eye examination as follows:
Ophthalmoscopy: using eye drops to dilate the pupils, the doctor will look through a special lens to examine your eyes.; Optical tomography: the doctor can do an optical tomography angiogram to closely observe the retina. Detailed images of the thickness of the retina help doctors find and measure the degree of macular edema.; OCT angiography: helps doctors see whether blood vessels in the retina are damaged or not. This is a new method to replace fluorescein angiography, patients do not need to inject contrast dye.
Surgical treatment of diabetic retinopathy.
